name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Thrilled to sign legislation that prohibits COVID-19 vaccine passports in Florida. Neither government, nor private businesses, will be able to condition your participation in everyday life on producing private health information.  https://t.co/0NMBk1l9zI

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Starting today, all Floridians who qualify under the FDA are eligible to receive a COVID-19 vaccine. This includes 18+ for Moderna and J&J, and 16+ for Pfizer. Join the 6 million Floridians who have already been vaccinated and pre-register at  https://t.co/Q6KhVWwoaX.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today I issued an executive order prohibiting the use of so-called COVID-19 vaccine passports. The Legislature is working on making permanent these protections for Floridians and I look forward to signing them into law soon. Read my EO here –  https://t.co/6QwLsLWEWm

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today I was pleased to sign SB 72 to protect Florida’s businesses and health care providers against frivolous COVID-19 lawsuits.  https://t.co/7YJ1OevoWW

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: I’m pleased to announce that beginning this Monday, March 29, all Floridians age 40 and older will be eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine. Beginning the following Monday, April 5, all Floridians age 18 and older will be eligible.  https://t.co/gJ0HHmiINW

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: I’m pleased to announce an additional COVID-19 vaccination site in Escambia County located at Zion Hope Primitive Baptist Church in Pensacola. This site will provide 2,000 doses of the J&J vaccine over the next three days to individuals 50 and older.  https://t.co/1IVj5DDVOK

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: The Covid-19 pandemic represented a test of elites in the U.S., from public-health experts to the corporate media. The results have been disappointing. Policy makers who bucked the elites & challenged the narrative have been proven right to do so.  https://t.co/HOmwuHZjKW

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Great to visit Panama City today to announce a new, three-day COVID-19 vaccination site that will provide 500 doses per day of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine at the A.D. Harris Learning Center. This walk-up site will be open from 9:00am to 4:30pm each day.  https://t.co/Igwflwcwai

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: It was great to be in Pinellas County today to announce a new COVID-19 vaccination site in Palm Harbor. This walk-up site will be open every day from 9:00am to 4:00pm and provide both the Pfizer and Johnson & Johnson vaccines.  https://t.co/LSp2ySeQI5

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Reminder - beginning today, all Floridians age 60 and older are eligible to receive a COVID-19 vaccine at any of the more than 1,000 vaccination sites across the state.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: I’m pleased to announce that @CVShealth will soon begin administering COVID-19 vaccines at 76 additional @CVSpharmacy locations across our state, bringing the total number of CVS vaccination locations in FL to 157 in 30 counties. More info here -  https://t.co/Y3jWFaWXlz  https://t.co/SWeUrGzpVh

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today, I was in St. Lucie County to announce an additional COVID-19 vaccination site will be opening at Spanish Lake Community. This new site will provide 2,300 Pfizer vaccines to seniors age 65 and older over the next three days. More here –  https://t.co/6EtYHGcqTX  https://t.co/H1S48N3GiX

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today the state announced the establishment of six COVID-19 vaccination sites — in addition to our Pahokee site — to provide greater access to the vaccine in underserved communities in the following counties: Broward, Duval, Leon, Miami-Dade, and Osceola.  https://t.co/RP2Zyc3Hf0

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: I’m pleased to announce that @CVSHealth will begin offering COVID-19 vaccinations at over 80 select pharmacy locations in 13 counties in FL, including every single @NavarroRx and @cvspharmacy y más location in Miami-Dade County. More info here –  https://t.co/qPurMbNoKi  https://t.co/9or8tjaByF

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Thank you again to Vern and Dottie Cummings for opening their home and allowing us to capture Vern receiving his COVID-19 vaccine. Vern and Dottie are great Americans and it’s because of Floridians like them that we are putting #SeniorsFirst.  https://t.co/qkJSAKxx3q

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today we announced the opening of a COVID-19 vaccination site in Pinellas Park that will provide 3,000 vaccines to seniors age 65 and older over the next three days. My administration remains committed to finding and fulfilling needs as quickly as possible. #SeniorsFirst  https://t.co/aokNXsxh6T

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Compared to Florida, 38 other states rank higher for COVID mortality among seniors 65 and older, per capita.  https://t.co/WhHa0notoh

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Compared to Florida, 34 states had a higher rate of all-cause mortality from 2019 to 2020, per capita. States with higher-than-average increases almost assuredly saw increased deaths resulting from lockdown policies, not just from COVID.  https://t.co/HnWcMsK5vi

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Weather conditions across the United States are impacting the shipment of the COVID-19 vaccine to Florida. @FLSERT and @HealthyFla are providing regular updates to our partners to ensure the vaccine is distributed as efficiently as possible as it arrives.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Thanks for being there to capture the moment @DaveElias. Captain John Arens is a legend, and it was great to be on hand yesterday to watch him receive his COVID-19 vaccine as part of our homebound seniors program.  https://t.co/25THfCfkDa

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: This morning I paid a visit to Captain John Arens, a 94 year-old veteran of four wars – WWII, the Korean, Vietnam, and Gulf Wars – as he and his wife Lois received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.  https://t.co/JJivkFRUuH

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today I was pleased to announce the establishment of a three-day, drive-thru COVID-19 vaccination site for seniors in the community of Kings Gate in Port Charlotte.  https://t.co/TeQ4xDFqL4

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Great to be at the Venice Community Center in Sarasota County today to announce the establishment of a three-day, drive-thru COVID-19 vaccination site.  https://t.co/oZHxDIPWQp

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: We draw inspiration from our Brigade veterans, and I was pleased to announce that we will be offering the COVID-19 vaccine to the veterans of the Bay of Pigs as part of our ongoing effort to vaccinate homebound seniors.  https://t.co/bTLZasiSbh

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Couldn’t have said it better @GlennaWPLG – Judy Rodan is a model of resiliency and I was fortunate to spend some time with her as she received her COVID-19 vaccine. It’s because of Floridians and stories like Judy’s that we are putting #SeniorsFirst.  https://t.co/qRGgOjHwI7

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Exciting news – Johnson & Johnson has requested emergency use authorization from the @US_FDA for their COVID-19 vaccine. Their one-shot dose would be a game changer for our vaccination efforts and commitment to putting Florida’s #SeniorsFirst.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today I announced an inter-faith COVID-19 vaccination site at Aventura Turnberry Jewish Center, an important faith-based vaccination site with representation from multiple faiths.  https://t.co/ay5VeHSd3v

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: As part of our effort to vaccinate homebound seniors, this morning I had the opportunity to visit with Judy Rodan, an 83 year old Holocaust survivor, as she received her second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today I was joined by two Pahokee natives & @FSUFootball greats, @AnquanBoldin & @floridalottery Sec. John Davis, to announce 500 COVID vaccinations for FL’s seniors in Western Palm Beach Co. We will work to expand doses here as we receive more supply from the federal government.  https://t.co/WkoPd35xOX

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: I’m pleased to announce 19 Publix Pharmacies in Pasco County, 42 in Pinellas County and 2 in Nassau County will begin offering the COVID-19 vaccine. This brings Florida's partnership with Publix to 325 pharmacies across 23 counties.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Our state has been tested many times before and has always passed with flying colors. Although our fight against COVID-19 has altered our economic landscape, Florida is on the road to recovery and will continue to lead.  #FloridaLeads

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic has underscored the need for mental health services, both in Florida and the rest of the country. The #FloridaLeads budget provides vital funding for Florida’s children and families.  https://t.co/cqpIdaAhMb

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Florida's students, parents and educators have faced significant disruptions and challenges due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The #FloridaLeads budget invests key resources aimed at improving the educational experience for students as well as that for their parents and teachers.  https://t.co/uAVudRsHBG

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: The budget maintains significant safeguards against COVID-19 and the potential effects of the 2021 hurricane season, while providing millions in tax relief for Florida families.  https://t.co/ZFjzC37eAQ

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: I’m pleased to announce that by February 1, the COVID-19 vaccine will have been offered to every resident and staff member of Florida’s nearly 700 nursing homes and over 3,000 ALFs. More here –  https://t.co/mALrwvKp9I

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Our Publix partnership continues to grow and I’m proud to announce that 22 @Publix Pharmacies in Brevard County will begin offering the COVID-19 vaccine to seniors starting this Thursday. We are committed to #SeniorsFirst in Florida.  https://t.co/EQ2eLLmcFh

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: It was great to be in Cape Coral this afternoon to announce that beginning Thursday, all 32 @Publix Pharmacies in Lee County will offer COVID-19 vaccines. In Florida, #SeniorsFirst remains our mantra.  https://t.co/0o3hIxWIVU

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: I've announced $85.8 million to address housing instability & homelessness due to COVID-19 & I remain committed to ensuring Floridians, no matter their circumstance, have the resources they need on their journey to economic stability and independence.  https://t.co/rOdliu2cJp

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today we announced the launch of a new COVID-19 vaccination site in partnership w/ @BrowardHealth at Inter Miami CF Stadium at Lockhart Park in Ft. Lauderdale. We continue to open new sites across FL to support the swift distribution of vaccines statewide.  https://t.co/6p0bFO6ZSb

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: This morning we announced the expansion of vaccine deployment to 56 additional @Publix pharmacies in Flagler, St. Johns, Volusia and Collier counties. This brings us to more than 100 @Publix pharmacies offering COVID-19 vaccines across 12 counties in Florida.  https://t.co/uPm77j1mo5

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: .@CDCgov is following FL's lead & will recommend states prioritize #SeniorsFirst for vaccine deployment. With 4.5M seniors & risks from COVID being more severe within this age group, our foremost goal must be to vaccinate our 65+ population. More info -  https://t.co/kr0YPQAqLb

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Earlier this week I announced a partnership with @Publix to establish COVID-19 vaccination sites in select supermarkets across three counties in FL.   Today I visited several locations in Hernando County where tremendous progress is being made.  https://t.co/HcNZk6JMf8

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: As part of our ongoing efforts to increase vaccinations and put Florida’s seniors first, I’m pleased to announce an innovative partnership with @Publix, a new pilot program to establish COVID-19 vaccination sites at select supermarkets. More info –  https://t.co/r1Sb2gOWmb

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Those 65+ will continue to be prioritized for vaccination in Florida. By putting seniors first, we are protecting a high-risk population from COVID-19.  https://t.co/A2Z9yBrSwM

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: We are committed to putting Florida’s Seniors First and protecting our most vulnerable residents from COVID-19. Today I announced four new actions the state is taking to continue our proactive approach to increase vaccinations, especially for those 65+.  https://t.co/LwFZFs2gK0

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Florida is making progress on getting the vaccine to those who are most at risk to COVID-19 and we will continue to prioritize our most vulnerable.  https://t.co/VKQiIbdJE4

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today I was joined by Palm Beach County Mayor @DavidMKerner and @HealthyFla to provide updates on Florida’s meaningful progress in our state's 3rd week of vaccine distribution. To date, 175,000+ Floridians have received a vaccine for COVID-19. More info -  https://t.co/aH0ryg6Lzc

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Despite the economic challenges brought on by COVID-19, we were fortunate to secure many victories in 2020 to ensure Florida’s economy continues to thrive.  https://t.co/d0rBTNT8A7

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic has further shown how important mental health and substance abuse initiatives are to those who are struggling, and we will continue to work to ensure Floridians in need have access to necessary resources.  https://t.co/CGDDAF4F3l

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Today I signed EO 20-315, outlining which populations should receive the COVID-19 vaccine during this first phase:   -LTC facility residents and staff -Persons 65 years of age and older  -Health care personnel with direct patient contact Read the EO here -  https://t.co/srt0kNqplb

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: FL is prioritizing our elderly population for vaccination against COVID-19. We are seeing progress made regarding residents of LTC facilities and will not be putting young & healthy “essential” employees ahead of our general 65+ population when it comes to vaccine distribution.  https://t.co/adbqIHjUiK

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Florida is preparing to receive 367,000 doses of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine next week pending EUA by the @US_FDA.   Doses of the vaccine will be distributed to 173 hospital locations across 43 counties throughout the state –  https://t.co/4dTQZvErU6

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Historic day for Florida and our country! Today I was proud to introduce Florida's first patient to receive a vaccine for COVID-19, frontline nurse Vanessa Arroyo. Thanks to Vanessa, as well as the entire team @TGHCares, for your efforts to make this possible.  https://t.co/gQYavdEBdK

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Yesterday @FLCaseyDeSantis and I were pleased to announce an additional $23 million in funding to bolster Florida’s mental health services system, as well as an additional funding initiative to support first responders who have been on the front lines of the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/il5g46LXfz

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: As our state prepares for vaccine distribution, I encourage all Floridians who have recovered from COVID-19 to consider donating convalescent plasma. Along with new therapeutics, this treatment offers life-saving benefits to those fighting the virus.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Vaccinating LTC residents first will reduce mortality with COVID significantly and will allow these facilities to return to normal operations, thereby reducing loneliness, despair and the failure to thrive.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: The top priority for vaccine allocation should be to residents of long-term care facilities. Residents of LTCs are by far the most likely demographic to die with COVID and the mitigation efforts undertaken by LTCs have dramatically reduced the quality of life for LTC residents.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: This month has brought promising news regarding our efforts to combat COVID-19. The State of Florida is prepared to work with the federal government to distribute vaccines to Florida hospitals in the upcoming weeks, as well as new therapeutic treatments for those most vulnerable.  https://t.co/TcVBKrKlEH

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: As we draw near to the release of a COVID-19 vaccine, I met w/ @SecAzar to discuss strategy & next steps for its distribution in Florida once available. We also discussed the availability of the new monoclonal antibody treatment & the promising prospects of this new therapeutic.

tweet: We will discuss what we’ve learned about COVID-19, the efficacy of non-pharmaceutical interventions, evidence-based approaches to K-12 schools & colleges/universities, the role of PCR testing in combatting the epidemic, and strategies to protect those most vulnerable to COVID-19.

tweet: The mental health impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on our children cannot be overstated. @FLCaseyDeSantis & I were honored to be joined by some of our state’s top leaders to discuss how we can support our families and kids through these challenging times.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Florida is receiving an additional shipment of over 38,200 vials of Remdesivir next week. Remdesivir is one of the treatments used by hospitals for COVID-positive patients.

name: Ron DeSantis

tweet: WATCH LIVE: COVID-19 press conference in Melbourne  https://t.co/TmSCeRXhTH

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: COVID-exclusive facilities are relieving pressure on both long-term care facilities & hospitals. Florida now has 20 of these facilities operational with 5 more pending. Ultimately, this will amount to nearly 1,700 beds.

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: Early on during the pandemic, Florida led the charge to prohibit the discharge of #COVID19 positive patients back to their residence in long-term care facilities & @AHCA_FL established COVID-exclusive nursing homes to care for these patients.

tweet: This Remdesivir supply will help more than 8k Floridians recover more quickly. We'll continue to implement our comprehensive strategy to support hospitals caring for COVID-positive patients, which includes securing more treatment and additional nurses. Together, we will succeed!

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: The CDC does not recommend healthy individuals to wear masks. The best way to prevent the spread of COVID-19 is by washing your hands, covering your cough or sneeze, and staying home if you are ill. For more information visit:  https://t.co/S3J03iZWQO  https://t.co/Iaz8yM1evx

name: Ron DeSantis
tweet: If you believe you have been exposed to COVID-19, please contact the COVID-19 Hotline: 1(866)779-6121 before visiting your healthcare provider to prevent the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/htLGkm7NL6
